results.title: Yusef Salaam Is Declared Winner of Harlem City Council Primary Race
results.abstract: Mr. Salaam was one of the Central Park Five who were wrongly convicted and then exonerated in the rape and assault of a jogger in Central Park in 1989.

results.title: As Cases Soar, ‘Dementia Villages’ Look Like the Future of Home Care
results.abstract: A new generation of treatment facilities is aiming to integrate dementia patients with the communities around them, blurring lines between home and hospital.

media.caption: The Hogeweyk dementia village in Weesp, Netherlands, opened in 2009 as a new model for treating people with dementia. The facility resembles a quaint Dutch village, with a town square, restaurant and other amenities.

results.title: Secret Service Investigating Who Brought Cocaine Into the White House
results.abstract: A baggie that was confirmed to contain cocaine was found in the guest lobby of the West Wing on Sunday evening, an agency spokesman said.

results.abstract: One of the world’s most visible public faces in the war on breast cancer, she helped reshape both the doctor’s role and the patient’s.

results.title: Who Knew the Colosseum Was So Old? Tourist Apologizes for Defacement.
results.abstract: A man who etched his initials and those of his girlfriend in a wall of the nearly 2,000-year-old monument wrote a letter of apology, and his lawyer says he is hoping for a plea bargain.

media.caption: The Colosseum in Rome, where a man used his keys to make an etching. A spate of incidents prompted lawmakers to stiffen penalties for those who vandalize Italy’s cultural heritage.

results.title: It’s Getting Hard to Stage a School Play Without Political Drama
results.abstract: At a time when lawmakers and parents are seeking to restrict what can and cannot be taught in classrooms, many teachers are seeing efforts to limit what can be staged in their auditoriums.

results.abstract: This fall, Americans will be urged to get shots against the flu, Covid and, if they’re older, R.S.V.

results.title: Five Minutes That Will Make You Love Avant-Garde Jazz
results.abstract: This challenging subgenre, including the subset of free jazz, is driven by the fire of spontaneity, and its rules are still being written. Eleven writers, critics and musicians share their favorites.
